meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or duty.
meanings.sent1: The manager was frustrated with the skivers who always found excuses to avoid their tasks.
meanings.sent2: The school had a few skivers who would skip class to hang out in the park.
meanings.sent3: The skivers in the office were always mysteriously absent whenever there was extra work to be done.
meanings.sent4: The team leader referred to the lazy employees as skivers, comparing them to professional nappers.
meanings.sent5: The skivers in the group were like shadows, always disappearing when there was work to be done.

meanings.definition: To avoid work or duty by pretending to be ill or busy.
meanings.sent1: She would often skivers her responsibilities by feigning sickness whenever a challenging task came up.
meanings.sent2: The students tried to skivers their homework by claiming they had too many other assignments.
meanings.sent3: He decided to skivers the boring meeting by pretending to be engrossed in his phone.
meanings.sent4: The employee tried to skivers the difficult project by constantly asking for extensions.
meanings.sent5: The cat would skivers its bath time by hiding under the bed every evening.
